item.title: Exploring Factors of Childhood that Affect Suicide Rates During Teenage Years in Canada
item.description: Motivation Suicide is a tragic public health concern, and in Canada, it is the second leading cause of death among young adults. This concerning trend demands a deeper understanding of the factors contributing to youth suicide. This research explores potential risk factors during childhood and adolescence. Hypothesis Excessive childhood screen time and low religious involvement are associated with a high suicide risk. Social rejection is an important factor, but it alone isn’t capable of triggering suicide, and overcoming the effects of any other variables.
